page.title: 18BRAINS FARM WINCANTON pt 3
page.content: {Calving:}A Holstein bull is put to the Friesian cows and calving is from October through to April. Last year they had 110 calves and of those they only have 35 left. Mr.Cocks deals with all the calving himself and only calls in the{vet}if an animal is sick. A farmer's life is very demanding.His animals rely on him all the time and he cannot leave them unattended. He only has{two helpers}with him on the farm. One is a farm labourer and the other a tractor driver. The labourer does the manual work, such as mucking out the pens. The tractor man feeds barley to the beef cattle, spreads slurry on the land in winter and cleans and maintains the machinery. Ditches are cleaned out to prevent flooding. A{contractor}is employed to trim the hedges in the Autumn.They are kept thick to prevent cattle escaping.
